My grandmother passed away, and all she left me in her will was an old sofa. My father was very angry, saying, "She took all her wealth to the grave! You're her only grandchild!" But I respected her will.

Grandma often read me fairy tales on this sofa, and I listened, fascinated, with a cup of tea. I loved spending time with her, and she understood me like no one else...

Influenced by childhood memories, I sat down on the sofa but instantly felt that something was wrong — a hard, sharp object was poking me in the back!

At my own risk, I cut open the sofa and found a green metal box. Inside were many papers and a letter addressed to me! I carefully opened it, and my heart stopped.

Here's what it said. ⬇️

At 75, Jessica liked to sit outside on her porch and watch the kids running around. She always brought a cup of tea and a book to read. It was a peaceful time, but inevitably, Jessica would reflect on her life during those moments. Today was one of those days.

She remembered her first wedding well, as it was the only time she had ever been excited to have one. Karl was the love of her life, or so she thought. But when she reached the end of the aisle on her father’s arm, she saw everyone’s worried faces. Karl had disappeared, and no one knew why.

Jessica cried on the steps of the Masonic Temple for several more hours. It was one of the best wedding venues in the city, and she had always dreamed of getting married there. However, it was not to be...

Despite this, "I had a great life," Jessica thought to herself while sipping her tea. It was true, although she never tried dating again. But once in a while, she thought about Karl and still wondered why he had disappeared.

Suddenly, the mailman snapped her out of her thoughts with a bright smile and a loud, “Hello, Mrs. Pennington! I have a letter for you!” Jessica took it in her hands, but the last thing she expected to see was the name 'Karl Pittman' on the envelope.👇
